alert.note: Alert for Monterey; San Benito (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 4:56PM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: .As frontal boundary moves through the Monterey Bay region, moderate to heavy rain has been falling the last hour and will continue for the next hour or two as front moves out of the area. Hourly rain rates of 0.2" to 0.4" have been observed. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following counties, Monterey and San Benito. * WHEN...Until 800 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 453 PM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.2 and 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.2 to 0.3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salinas, Seaside, Monterey, Marina, Jamesburg, Tassajara Hot Springs, Arroyo Seco, Big Sur Village, Soledad, Greenfield, Pacific Grove, Gonzales, Carmel-By-The-Sea, Carmel Valley Village, Cachagua Near The Los Padres Dam, San Clemente Dam, Chualar, Spreckels, Pico Blanco Campground and Sycamore Flat. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
